actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Oversight.

official_title: To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to provide for partial removal of limitations on contributions to candidates whose opponents exceed personal contribution limitations in an election.

summary.text: Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to: (1) partially remove contribution limitations for a candidate whose opponent uses more than $1,000 of personal funds in an election; and (2) require notification for independent expenditures made within seven days of an election.

titles.title: To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to provide for partial removal of limitations on contributions to candidates whose opponents exceed personal contribution limitations in an election.
